intro: Pinanga canina f. minor, commonly known as the small-leaved pinanga, is a fern species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate fronds. The plant features lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are typically shorter than those of the standard Pinanga canina. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for horticultural collections.
